title: Leber Hereditary Optic Neuropathy (LHON): Clinical Overview and Diagnostic Guidelines
short_description: Clinical document describing Leber hereditary optic neuropathy, a mitochondrial genetic disorder causing bilateral vision loss in young adults.
long_description: This clinical reference document provides a comprehensive overview of Leber hereditary optic neuropathy (LHON), a rare mitochondrial genetic disorder affecting approximately 1 in 50,000 people. The document details the characteristic presentation of bilateral, painless subacute central vision loss typically occurring in young adults, with males being 4-5 times more likely to be affected than females. It covers the maternal inheritance pattern due to mitochondrial DNA mutations, rare associated neurological complications, and diagnostic approaches including ophthalmologic examination, specialized visual testing, electrophysiologic studies, neuroimaging, and molecular genetic testing for confirmation.
